reviews.review_msg: Easy content, and weekly quizzes with 3 attempts were basically guaranteed marks. However lectures weren't very interesting, and he changed grading criteria on final project which lead to many people in the class loosing marks for no reason. Poor communication about grading and assignments

Be very careful with this professor. He is quite disorganized and frequently changes the class structure and grading abitraly. There was frequent errors made in grading that he would simply not address or be very passive aggressive about (requiring escalation to chair). Review your work extremely careful and be prepared to involve administration.

Most confusing syllabus and rubric. Grading system is strict and uses a “points” systems instead of percentages. Rubrics are vague, while using essentially a pass/fail system without any mention. Whenever students expressed confusion or distress about anything, he responded passive-aggressively or just outright provided zero clarity.

This class was pretty interesting and not too difficult content wise, but Shawn's weird decisions made things more difficult than they needed to be. He completely restructured how he distributed grades, his assignments are so poorly designed and have inconsistent criteria, which leads to inconsistent grading and overall he's a bit of a knob. Boo

Lectures were often confusing and contained mistakes. Assignments, especially the last poster one were confusing and had overtly strict and weird formatting criteria. He was also very unhelpful, and sometimes rude when contacted regarding assignment questions. Weekly quizzes were best out of 3 so that was nice at least.
